abstract: Federal jury in Seattle convicts Raymond Fryberg of six counts of unlawful possession of a firearm; Fryberg's son used his father's illegally owned handgun to kill four friends and himself at Marysville-Pilchuck High School in north Seattle in 2014; Fryberg faces up to 10 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A federal jury in Seattle found a man guilty on Tuesday of illegally owning firearms, including the handgun his son used to kill four of his friends and himself last year in a school cafeteria.

headline.main: Washington: School Killer’s Father Is Found Guilty of Gun Charges
headline.print_headline: Washington: School Killer’s Father Is Found Guilty of Gun Charges

snippet: A federal jury in Seattle found a man guilty on Tuesday of illegally owning firearms, including the handgun his son used to kill four of his friends and himself last year in a school cafeteria.
